member.name: M:Xceed.Ftp.AsyncFtpClient.BeginReceiveMultipleFiles(System.String,System.String,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.AsyncCallback,System.Object)
member.summary: Begins the process of retreiving the files that match the provided file mask from the current working folder and stores them on the local system in the specified folder. Don't forget to call !
member.param: The file mask of the remote files to receive. This parameter can include a filtering mask to limit the files that are received. For example, if is specified, the entire contents of the current working folder will be received. If "*.txt" is used, all the files in the current working folder that have the TXT extension will be received. Some FTP servers may be case-sensitive!
The path and name of the local folder where the files will be stored.
if the files in child folders should also be received; otherwise.
if the remote directory structure should be recreated on the local machine; otherwise.
Callback method to be called when the asynchronous operation is completed.
An object containing state information for this operation.
member.returns: An representing the status of the asynchronous operation.

remarks.para: If a folder is specified in , for example "MyFiles/*" and is set to , the "MyFiles" folder will be recreated locally in . If only a file mask is specified in , the files/folders will be recreated directly in .

By default, the files that match the provided file mask will be received from the current working folder. If you want to receive the files from another location, you could use the / methods and/or / methods to change the current working folder. Absolute paths can also be provided, however some FTP servers might not support absolute paths and different server types may have different ways of representing absolute paths.
The current working folder can be retrieved via the / methods.

para.note: By default, if an error occurs during the multiple-file transfer, the entire operation will be aborted. To change this behavior, the event must be handled and its property set to either Retry or Ignore.
The TYPE command will be sent regardless of the value of the property when calling the BeginReceiveMultipleFiles method during the initial listing phase.

When using a , the is provided as a parameter. You should call in that callback. When NOT providing a callback, you should keep the returned IAsyncResult and call EndReceiveMultipleFiles with it when ready to complete. In this later case, the call to EndReceiveMultipleFiles may block until the operation completes.

In this later case, the call to EndSendFileToUniqueName may block until the operation completes.

member.name: M:Xceed.Ftp.AsyncFtpClient.EndSendFileToUniqueName(System.IAsyncResult)
member.summary: Ends the process of sending a file to the FTP server's current working folder and storing it using a unique filename.
member.param: An representing the status of the asynchronous operation.
member.returns: A string representing the unique name that was generated for the file that was sent to the FTP server.

member.name: M:Xceed.Ftp.AsyncFtpClient.BeginSendMultipleFiles(System.String,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.AsyncCallback,System.Object)
member.summary: Begins the process of sending the files that match the provided file mask to the FTP server's current working folder. Don't forget to call !
member.param: The full path and file mask of the local files to send. This parameter can include a filtering mask to limit the files that are sent. For example, if "c:\temp\*" is specified, the entire contents of the "c:\temp" will be sent. If "c:\temp\*.txt" is used, all the files in the "c:\temp" folder that have the TXT extension will be sent. The "temp" folder will not be recreated on the FTP server.
if the files in child folders should also be sent; otherwise.
if the local directory structure should be recreated on the FTP server; otherwise.
Callback method to be called when the asynchronous operation is completed.
An object containing state information for this operation.
member.returns: An representing the status of the asynchronous operation.

remarks.para: The files that match the provided file mask will be sent to the current working folder. If you want to send the files to another location, you could use the / methods and/or / methods to change the current working folder.
The current working folder can be retrieved via the / methods.

para.note: By default, if an error occurs during the multiple-file transfer, the entire operation will be aborted. To change this behavior, the event must be handled and its property set to either Retry or Ignore.

When using a , the is provided as a parameter. You should call in that callback. When NOT providing a callback, you should keep the returned IAsyncResult and call EndSendMultipleFiles with it when ready to complete. In this later case, the call to EndSendMultipleFiles may block until the operation completes.

member.name: M:Xceed.Ftp.AsyncFtpClient.EndSendMultipleFiles(System.IAsyncResult)
member.summary: Ends the process of sending the files that match the provided file mask to the FTP server's current working folder.
member.param: An representing the status of the asynchronous operation.

member.name: M:Xceed.Ftp.AsyncFtpClient.BeginSendCustomCommand(System.String,System.AsyncCallback,System.Object)
member.summary: Begins the process of sending a custom command to the FTP server. Don't forget to call !
member.param: The command to send to the FTP server.
Callback method to be called when the asynchronous operation is completed.
An object containing state information for this operation.
member.returns: An representing the status of the asynchronous operation.

remarks.para: The BeginSendCustomCommand method is used to send FTP commands. This means that commands you enter using the Windows command-line FTP (such as "dir", "put" or "debug") are not the commands that are actually sent to the FTP server. Although these commands might be recognized by some FTP servers, they are not guaranteed to work!.
When sending a custom FTP command, the local folder separator character will not be replaced by the to allow the local folder separator character to be sent "as is".

Not all commands are supported by all FTP servers. In order to determine which commands are supported, you can use the BeginSendCustomCommand/ methods to send the "HELP" command. For example: ftp.SendCustomCommand( "HELP" );.

para.note: The BeginSendCustomCommand method does not support custom commands that require a data connection such as STOR (), RETR (), NLST and LIST (), etc.

When using a , the is provided as a parameter. You should call in that callback. When NOT providing a callback, you should keep the returned IAsyncResult and call EndSendCustomCommand with it when ready to complete. In this later case, the call to EndSendCustomCommand may block until the operation completes.

member.name: M:Xceed.Ftp.AsyncFtpClient.EndSendCustomCommand(System.IAsyncResult)
member.summary: Ends the process of sending a custom command to the FTP server.
member.param: An representing the status of the asynchronous operation.
member.returns: The reply received from the FTP server in response to the custom command.

member.summary: Gets or sets the object used to automatically redirect events on the main UI thread.
member.value: The object used to automatically redirect events on the main UI thread. By default, .

remarks.para: In order for the SynchronizingObject to work, your application must be pumping messages, either explicitly while waiting for completion (Application.DoEvents), or by not calling any blocking methods and returning control to your application's main loop (Application.Run in Main).
This property is not taken into consideration when using blocking method calls such as and .

Some example system stores are listed in the following table.
Predefined system store name Meaning
"CA" Certification authority certificates.
"MY" A certificate store holding "My" certificates with their associated private keys.
"ROOT" Root certificates.
"SPC" Software publisher certificates.

member.name: M:Xceed.Ftp.FtpListingParser.CreateItem
member.summary: Creates a new object.
member.returns: A reference to a new object.

remarks.para: You can override this method if you wish to derive from FtpItemInfo and expose more information. This enables you to not only derive from FtpListingParser to implement your own custom parser, but also from existing parsers.

If you derive from FtpListingParser and FtpItemInfo to provide your own custom parser, it is recommended that you override this method so that others can derive from your parser and your info classes to add even more information.

member.param: The listing line received from the FTP server.
member.returns: A reference to an object containing the information that was parsed from the listing line received from the FTP server. Can be to indicate that the line was recognized but more information is required (for example, VMS listings are on 2 lines). Can be to indicate that the listing line was not recognized as a valid AS400 listing line.

remarks.para: The AS400 listing parser will try to parse the listing lines received from the FTP server. After 5 failed attempts, the AS400 listing parser will be discarded by the .

member.name: T:Xceed.Ftp.FtpReply
member.summary: Represents a reply received from the FTP server.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the FtpReply class.

member.name: M:Xceed.Ftp.FtpReply.ToString
member.summary: Returns a string representing the reply received from the FTP server.
member.returns:
A string representing the reply received from the FTP server. For example:
230-The response `guest' is not valid. 230-Next time please use your e-mail address as password. 230 Guest login ok, access restrictions apply.

member.name: P:Xceed.Ftp.FtpReply.Lines
member.summary: Gets the lines returned by the FTP server as a reply to a command.
member.value: A containing a list of all the lines, including the returned by the FTP server as a reply to a command.

remarks.para:
The lines of the reply are the custom lines returned by the FTP server. For example, the "welcome" message. The is the text following the last line of the full text returned by the FTP server. For example:
220-Welcome! Thank you for using Xceed FTP for .NET 220 Have fun!
"Have fun!" is the .

member.name: P:Xceed.Ftp.FtpReply.Message
member.summary: Gets the text following the last line of the full text returned by the FTP server without the reply code.
member.value: A string representing the last line of the full text returned by the FTP server without the reply code.

remarks.para:
The of the reply are the custom lines returned by the FTP server. For example, the "welcome" message. The Message is the text following the last line of the full text returned by the FTP server. For example:
220-Welcome! Thank you for using Xceed FTP for .NET 220 Have fun!
"Have fun!" is the Message.

member.name: P:Xceed.Ftp.FtpReply.ReplyCode
member.summary: Gets the reply code returned by the FTP server.
member.value: A value representing the reply code returned by the FTP server. Can be between 100 and 559 inclusively.

remarks.para:
The following table provides a list of the possible reply codes returned by an FTP server.
110Restart marker reply.
120Service ready in nnn minutes.
125Data connection already open; transfer starting.
150File status okay; about to open data connection.
200Command okay.
202Command not implemented, superfluous at this site.
211System status, or system help reply.
212Directory status.
213File status
214Help message.
215NAME system type.
220Service ready for new user.
221Service closing control connection.
225Data connection open; no transfer in progress.
226Closing data connection.
227Entering Passive Mode (h1,h2,h3,h4,p1,p2).
230User logged in, proceed.
250Requested file action okay, completed.
257"PATHNAME" created.
331User name okay, need password.
332Need account for login.
350Requested file action pending further information.
421Service not available, closing control connection.
425Can't open data connection.
426Connection closed; transfer aborted.
450Requested file action not taken. File unavailable (e.g., file busy).
451Requested action aborted: local error in processing.
452Requested action not taken. Insufficient storage space in system.
500Syntax error, command unrecognized.
501Syntax error in parameters or arguments.
502Command not implemented.
503Bad sequence of commands.
504Command not implemented for that parameter.
530Not logged in.
532Need account for storing files.
550Requested action not taken. File unavailable (e.g., file not found, no access).
551Requested action aborted: page type unknown.
552Requested file action aborted. Exceeded storage allocation (for current directory or dataset).
553Requested action not taken. File name not allowed.

member.name: P:Xceed.Ftp.FtpReply.Type
member.summary: Gets a value representing the type of reply received from the FTP server.
member.value: A representing the type of reply received from the FTP server.

remarks.para:
The following table provides a list of the types of reply codes that can be returned by an FTP server.
IncompleteMore lines are expected therefore this reply is still incomplete. You should never receive such a reply, as this value is used internally.
PositivePreliminaryThe requested action is being initiated and another reply should be expected before proceeding with a new command. Any reply between 100 and 159 inclusively is a positive preliminary reply.
PositiveCompletionThe requested action has successfully completed and a new request may be initiated. Any reply between 200 and 259 inclusively is a positive completion reply.
PositiveIntermediateThe command was accepted, but the requested action is being held in abeyance, pending receipt of further information. Another command specifying this information is expected by the FTP server. Any reply between 300 and 359 inclusively is a positive intermediate reply.
TransientNegativeCompletionThe command was not accepted and the requested action did not take place, but the error condition is not permanent and the action may be requested again once the problem is addressed. Any reply between 400 and 459 inclusively is a transient negative completion reply.
PermanentNegativeCompletionThe command was not accepted and the requested action did not take place. Any reply between 500 and 559 inclusively is a permanent negative completion reply.
InvalidThe format of the reply received from the FTP server was not recognized.

para.note: For a list of specific reply codes, consult the property.

para.note: For a list of specific reply codes, consult the property of the class.

member.name: T:Xceed.Ftp.Licenser
member.summary: Class which is used to register the classes located in the Xceed.Ftp namespace.

remarks.para: We recommend you set the LicenseKey property in the main entry point of the application. For example, the LicenseKey property can be set, for C# users, in the static main function. For VB.NET users, it can be set in the constructor of the main form or in the "Sub Main" procedure. If no entry point is available, it is recommended that the LicenseKey property be set in a static constructor of a class that will be accessed systematically before any of the library's classes are instantiated or, you can simply set the LicenseKey property immediately BEFORE you instantiate a class.

member.name: P:Xceed.Ftp.ParsingListingLineEventArgs.Line
member.summary: Gets the listing line which was returned by the FTP server and used to create the Item.
member.value: A string representing the listing line which was returned by the FTP server and used to create the .

member.name: P:Xceed.Ftp.ParsingListingLineEventArgs.Valid
member.summary: Gets or sets a boolean value indicating if the listing line returned by the FTP server was valid.
member.value: if the listing represents a valid item; otherwise.

remarks.para: If Valid is when the event is raised, at least one parser succeeded in parsing the listing line and has been filled with the parsed information. To filter (remove) an item from the listing set Valid to . The content of Item can also be modified if you want to change the item's information.
If Valid is when the event is raised, none of the parsers succeeded in parsing the listing line. In this case you can provide your own parsing, fill Item and set Valid to .

member.name: T:Xceed.Ftp.RepresentationType
member.summary: Value representing the representation type to use when sending or receiving files.

member.name: F:Xceed.Ftp.RepresentationType.Ascii
member.summary: The data will be sent/received using the standard 8-bit NVT-ASCII representation. This representation type is intended primarily for the transfer of text files.

member.name: F:Xceed.Ftp.RepresentationType.Binary
member.summary: The data will be sent/received as contiguous bits which are packed into the 8-bit transfer bytes. This representation type is intended for the efficient storage and retrieval of files and for the transfer of binary data.

member.name: T:Xceed.Ftp.VerificationAction
member.summary: Value representing the verification action to take in the event when a certificate is received from an FTP server..

member.name: F:Xceed.Ftp.VerificationAction.Accept
member.summary: Accept the FTP server's certificate.

member.name: F:Xceed.Ftp.VerificationAction.Reject
member.summary: Reject the FTP server's certificate and make the connection or authentication fail.

member.name: F:Xceed.Ftp.VerificationAction.VerifyAgain
member.summary: Verify the certificate again. The Flags property should have been updated to now accept the current reject reason. The event will be raised again with the new status.

member.name: T:Xceed.Ftp.VerificationFlags
member.summary: Value representing the different verification flags used to verify an FTP server's certificate.

remarks.para: More than one verification flag can be combined using the OR operator.

member.name: F:Xceed.Ftp.VerificationFlags.None
member.summary: No flags. This is the most severe form of validation: No certificate anomalies will be accepted.

member.name: F:Xceed.Ftp.VerificationFlags.IgnoreTimeNotValid
member.summary: Ignore an invalid time.

member.name: F:Xceed.Ftp.VerificationFlags.IgnoreCtlTimeNotValid
member.summary: Ignore an invalid time of the certificate trust list.

member.name: F:Xceed.Ftp.VerificationFlags.IgnoreTimeNotNested
member.summary: Ignore an invalid time nesting.

member.name: F:Xceed.Ftp.VerificationFlags.IgnoreInvalidBasicConstraints
member.summary: Ignore invalid basic constraints.

member.name: F:Xceed.Ftp.VerificationFlags.IgnoreAllTimeChecks
member.summary: Ignore all time checks.

member.name: F:Xceed.Ftp.VerificationFlags.AllowUnknownCA
member.summary: Allow an unknown certificate authority.

member.name: F:Xceed.Ftp.VerificationFlags.IgnoreWrongUsage
member.summary: Ignore the wrong usage of a certificate.

member.name: F:Xceed.Ftp.VerificationFlags.IgnoreInvalidName
member.summary: Ignore an invalid name.

member.name: F:Xceed.Ftp.VerificationFlags.IgnoreInvalidPolicy
member.summary: Ignore an invalid policy.

member.name: F:Xceed.Ftp.VerificationFlags.IgnoreEndRevUnknown
member.summary: Ignore an unknown revocation status of the end certificate.

member.name: F:Xceed.Ftp.VerificationFlags.IgnoreSignerRevUnknown
member.summary: Ignore an unknown revocation status of the signer certificate.

member.name: F:Xceed.Ftp.VerificationFlags.IgnoreCARevUnknown
member.summary: Ignore an unknown revocation status of the certificate authority.

member.name: F:Xceed.Ftp.VerificationFlags.IgnoreRootRevUnknown
member.summary: Ignore an unknown revocation status of the root certificate.

member.name: F:Xceed.Ftp.VerificationFlags.IgnoreAllRevUnknown
member.summary: Ignore an unknown revocation status of any of the certificates.

member.name: F:Xceed.Ftp.VerificationFlags.AllowTestRoot
member.summary: Allow a test root.

member.name: F:Xceed.Ftp.VerificationFlags.TrustTestRoot
member.summary: Trust a test root.

member.name: T:Xceed.Ftp.VerificationStatus
member.summary: Value representing the different certificate status values.

member.name: F:Xceed.Ftp.VerificationStatus.ValidCertificate
member.summary: The certificate is valid.

member.name: F:Xceed.Ftp.VerificationStatus.Expired
member.summary: A required certificate is not within its validity period.

member.name: F:Xceed.Ftp.VerificationStatus.InvalidBasicConstraints
member.summary: The certificate's basic constraints are invalid or missing.

member.name: F:Xceed.Ftp.VerificationStatus.InvalidChain
member.summary: A chain of certificates was not correctly created.

member.name: F:Xceed.Ftp.VerificationStatus.InvalidNesting
member.summary: The validity periods of the certification chain do not nest correctly.

member.name: F:Xceed.Ftp.VerificationStatus.InvalidPurpose
member.summary: A certificate is being used for a non-permitted purpose.

member.name: F:Xceed.Ftp.VerificationStatus.InvalidRole
member.summary: A certificate that can only be used as an end-entity is being used as a CA or visa-versa.

member.name: F:Xceed.Ftp.VerificationStatus.InvalidSignature
member.summary: The signature of the certificate cannot be verified.

member.name: F:Xceed.Ftp.VerificationStatus.NoCNMatch
member.summary: The certificate's CN name does not match the passed value.

member.name: F:Xceed.Ftp.VerificationStatus.ParentRevoked
member.summary: A certificate in the chain has been explicitly revoked by its issuer.

member.name: F:Xceed.Ftp.VerificationStatus.RevocationFailure
member.summary: The revocation process could not continue. The certificates could not be checked.

member.name: F:Xceed.Ftp.VerificationStatus.RevocationServerOffline
member.summary: Since the revocation server was offline, the called function was not able to complete the revocation check.

member.name: F:Xceed.Ftp.VerificationStatus.Revoked
member.summary: The certificate or signature has been revoked.

member.name: F:Xceed.Ftp.VerificationStatus.UntrustedRoot
member.summary: A certification chain processed correctly but terminated in a root certificate not trusted by the trust provider.

member.name: F:Xceed.Ftp.VerificationStatus.UntrustedTestRoot
member.summary: The root certificate is a testing certificate and policy settings disallow test certificates.

member.name: F:Xceed.Ftp.VerificationStatus.WrongUsage
member.summary: The certificate is not valid for the requested usage.

member.name: F:Xceed.Ftp.VerificationStatus.OtherError
member.summary: The certificate is invalid.
